text: [Music]
I was born in Iran in 1972 And um spent
my first seven years there uh we came
from a fairly large and well-off family
sort of a landed aristocracy of Northern
Teran and um so I had in some ways a
fairly traditional upbringing because of
my father's family very tribal they're
actually bakari in in Heritage um so it
was not uncommon for um the sons and
their wives and their children to for
everyone to live in one giant house my
mother on the other hand came from sort
of Iran's nvo R uh her parents were uh
stage and film actors she came from a
very large entertainment family and at
that time traditional households like my
father's would have seen my mother's
household especially because her parents
were divorced as somewhat loose uh and
and and perhaps uh not uh adequate to
join their family in fact my father had
already been uh betrothed to someone
else since he was she was about s years
old um and uh even though uh he met my
mother in college and fell in love with
her they had to essentially put an end
to the relationship because my father
had to marry somebody else fortunately
for him uh that woman that he was
supposed to marry uh also fell in love
and actually had the guts to run away
with her uh love um whereas my father
didn't H but that did open up the door
for my parents to actually get married
and move into my father's house and so I
really grew up surrounded by a very
large extended family and in many ways
was sheltered from some of the political
upheavals that were taking place in 78
and 79 for the most part um what I
understood was happening uh was you know
whatever I could see outside of my
window um the and and you know for a kid
you know all that mattered is that
school was cancelled and and that you
didn't have to they they had to stay
home all the time um so I really don't
remember too much about the turmoil
itself I do sort of have a sense of the
fear and the anxiety that that was you
know ever present um during especially
those last few months before the Sha uh
was exiled uh but we left Iran um pretty
much right after the Ayatollah Ki
arrived um we got all our stuff together
we basically allowed to take one
suitcase each and and got out on one of
the last flights um and arrived in
Oklahoma of all places uh not really
knowing anything about America so that
was kind of a a shock and spent a year
or so uh getting used to uh the United
States by watching a lot of Television a
lot of uh sitcoms and uh chips and Bugs
Bunny cartoons and then ultimately uh we
moved to Northern California where there
was a much larger Iranian uh community
and and that's where I grew up in San
Jose San Francisco the Bay Area
